subject: AI & Agents
title: Autoregressive Text Generation
description: A fast breakdown of Autoregressive Text Generation for builders.

hook.text: The model writes one word, then uses it to predict the next. Repeat until done.

buildup.text: Autoregressive generation produces tokens left to right, each conditioned on all previous ones.

discovery.text: This is how GPT, Claude, and Llama generate every response you read.

twist.text: Errors compound: one bad token early on can derail the entire generation.

climax.text: Techniques like beam search and nucleus sampling balance quality and diversity.

punchline.text: One token at a time. That's all it ever does.

quiz.question: How does autoregressive generation work?
options: Produces tokens one at a time, each conditioned on previous ones
